Drought threaten growth of crops
   Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- Growth of crops has been seriously threatened by drought continuing in Korea.   Precipitation was lowered by warm and dry wind from the west in the period between January and May, and drought hit most parts of the country including Kangwon and north and south Hamgyong provinces.
   Chongjin in particular has had no rain for 92 consecutive days and Wonsan and Hamhung for 119 consecutive days.   
   According to data available at the long-term forecast institute of the Hydro-Meteorological Service,  the drought was caused by change of air current in the north hemisphere of the earth. Such air current is believed to continue in the future. 
   The agricultural and other sectors of the national economy are taking measures to prevent damage from drought.
